Entries.default:
"We gather in the sight of Woedica and Wael to thresh truth from falsehood and see justice upheld."

The voice seems to echo from nowhere in particular, though the figures before you present the tableau of a trial in progress.
The central figures, each a hooded reflection of the others, turn their masked faces towards you. One raises a long, thin finger, pointing at you from across an open pit.
"I'm not entirely sure how I got here, actually. "
"I'm sorry, I left my robe outside. I'll happily go get it."
"Or where here is, for that matter."
"That one's invocation of Woedica and Wael suggests it some manner of trial."
"We don't exactly blend in with the crowd. Maybe we should think about that next time you go barging into... whatever this is?"
"Perhaps Thaos' headdress would mollify her. Now, where did I put that...?"
"Mayhaps we should be masking ourselves before we go sneaking into secret gathers."
"Am I the only one of us who thought to bring a mask?"
